steps: Sauté finely chopped onion and diced carrot in olive oil/butter for 3–4 minutes until softened.
Add tomato paste and cook 1 minute to remove raw taste.
Pour in broth (or water + a little bouillon). Bring to a gentle boil.
Add orzo. Simmer 10–12 minutes, stirring occasionally so it doesn’t stick.
Season with salt and pepper. Add dried mint at the end if you like.
Rest 3 minutes and serve hot.

allergens: May contain gluten (if pasta is used)
steps: Boil chicken with onion in water/broth until tender; remove chicken and shred it.
Strain broth (optional) for a cleaner soup.
Add diced carrot (and rice/pasta if using) to the broth and simmer until soft.
Return shredded chicken to the pot and warm 2–3 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Add a little lemon juice if desired.
Serve hot.

allergens: May contain dairy (if butter is used)
steps: Sauté onion in butter/olive oil for 2–3 minutes.
Add chopped mixed vegetables and cook 4–5 minutes.
Stir in tomato paste and paprika; cook 1 minute.
Add broth, bring to a boil, then simmer 15–20 minutes until vegetables are tender.
Optional: add small pre-cooked chicken/beef pieces for extra protein.
Season and serve.
Sauté onion and garlic in butter/olive oil for 2 minutes.
Add sliced mushrooms and cook 6–8 minutes until they release water and soften.
Optional thickening: sprinkle flour and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.
Add broth gradually, stirring to avoid lumps. Simmer 10 minutes.
Optional: add milk/cream and heat gently (do not boil hard).
Season with salt and pepper and serve.
Cook rice in water/broth until soft (10–12 minutes).
In a bowl whisk yogurt with egg (optional) and a spoon of flour (optional) until smooth.
Temper: add a few ladles of hot soup liquid into the yogurt mixture, whisking.
Pour tempered mixture back into the pot on low heat, stirring constantly (do not let it boil hard).
Season with salt.
Optional: melt butter with mint and drizzle on top before serving.
Slice chicken breast and gently pound to even thickness.
Season with salt and pepper.
Coat in flour, then beaten egg, then breadcrumbs (press crumbs to stick well).
Heat oil in a pan (medium heat).
Fry 3–4 minutes per side until golden and cooked through.
Drain on paper towel and serve.
Season steak with salt and pepper. Sear on a hot pan 2–4 minutes per side (depending on thickness). Rest 5 minutes.
In the same pan sauté onion/garlic, then add mushrooms and cook 6–8 minutes.
Optional: add a splash of cream and simmer 1–2 minutes for a sauce.
Serve steak topped with mushrooms.
Optional marinade: mix yogurt, crushed garlic, paprika, cumin, salt and pepper. Coat chicken and rest 30–120 minutes.
Heat grill pan with a little oil.
Cook chicken on medium heat, turning until browned and fully cooked (10–18 minutes depending on pieces).
Rest 3–5 minutes before serving.

Çökertme Kebabı.name_en: Çökertme Kebab (Beef/Chicken over Crispy Potatoes & Yogurt)
Çökertme Kebabı.name_ru: Чёкертме кебаб (мясо на хрустящем картофеле с йогуртом)
steps: Cut potatoes into thin matchsticks. Rinse, dry well, then fry or bake until crispy. Salt lightly.
Season and sauté thin meat strips in a hot pan until cooked and browned.
Mix yogurt with crushed garlic and a pinch of salt.
Make sauce: melt butter/oil, add tomato paste and a little water; simmer 2–3 minutes. Add paprika.
Plate: crispy potatoes base → garlic yogurt → meat → tomato-butter sauce on top.
Rub chicken with oil, salt, pepper, paprika (and garlic/thyme if available).
Bake at 200°C for ~35–45 minutes until golden and juices run clear (or internal temp is safe).
Rest 5 minutes and serve.
Rinse rice until water runs clearer; soak 10 minutes (optional) and drain.
Sauté rice in butter/oil for 2–3 minutes.
Add hot broth/water + salt (typical ratio ~1:1.5).
Cover and simmer on low until liquid absorbs (12–15 minutes).
Rest 10 minutes covered, then fluff and serve.

ingredients: Cracked wheat or whole wheat berries
steps: Soak wheat (optional) then simmer until very soft.
Cook meat until tender; shred (chicken) or pull apart (beef).
Combine wheat + meat with salt; cook until thick and porridge-like.
Traditional texture: mash/stir strongly until creamy.
Top with melted butter + paprika and serve.
Boil pasta in salted water until al dente.
Drain (reserve a little pasta water).
Return to pot, add butter, toss to coat. Add a splash of pasta water if needed.
Season and serve.
Lightly toast vermicelli in butter/oil until golden.
Add rinsed rice and sauté 2 minutes.
Add hot broth/water + salt and simmer covered on low 12–15 minutes.
Rest 10 minutes, fluff, serve.
Toast vermicelli in oil/butter until lightly golden.
Optional: sauté onion and a spoon of tomato paste for more flavor.
Add bulgur, stir 1 minute.
Add hot water/broth (about 1:2), salt, pepper. Cover and simmer 12–15 minutes.
Rest 10 minutes and fluff.
Sauté onion in oil until translucent.
Add tomato paste + paprika; cook 1 minute.
Add cooked chickpeas and enough water/broth to cover.
Optional: add pre-cooked beef cubes.
Simmer 15–20 minutes; season and serve.
Sauté onion in olive oil 3–4 minutes.
Add green beans and cook 3 minutes.
Add tomatoes/tomato paste + water; simmer covered 25–35 minutes until tender.
Season and serve (often eaten warm).
Sauté onion in oil 2–3 minutes.
Add tomato paste + paprika, cook 1 minute.
Add cubed potatoes, mix well.
Add water to half-cover, simmer 20–25 minutes until soft.
Season and serve.
Sauté onion in oil, add tomato paste and cook 1 minute.
Add diced carrot (and potato if used) and peas.
Add water/broth, simmer 20 minutes until vegetables are soft.
Season and serve.

ingredients: Optional: garlic, yogurt on the side
allergens: May contain dairy (if served with yogurt)
steps: Sauté onion in olive oil 2–3 minutes.
Add washed spinach and cook 4–6 minutes until wilted.
Season with salt and pepper. Optional garlic at the end.
Serve warm.
Serve chilled. Optional: add a pinch of salt if it’s served as a side for savory dishes.
Wash, peel, and serve.
Wash, peel, and serve.
Prepare base batter/dough with flour + poppy seeds + fat (butter/oil) and bake until set.
Cook syrup: boil sugar + water 8–10 minutes (light syrup).
Pour warm syrup over warm dessert and let it absorb 20–30 minutes.
Cut and serve.
Whisk milk, sugar, cornstarch (and rice flour if used) in a pot until smooth.
Cook on medium heat, stirring constantly, until thick pudding forms.
For the ‘burnt’ bottom: spread a thin layer in a wide pan and gently caramelize the base (traditional method).
Cool, slice/roll, serve chilled.
Prepare sponge layers (or use pre-baked).
Whip cream and fold with chestnut puree to make chestnut cream.
Layer sponge + cream, repeat, then chill 2–4 hours.
Decorate and serve chilled.
